content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to John Bennett, 16 January 18461 The enclosed letters I wrote last night, but when I went to thePost-officethis morning your mail had left about half an hour–2So I send them by MrHarris– Will^you^please take out the one addressed to you, and drop the others in your Post-office,
               unless you see the men to hand them to in person, in which case please do that– Per. MrHarris
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to John Bennett, 16 January 18461

The enclosed letters I wrote last night, but when I went to thePost-officethis morning your mail had left about half an hour–2So I send them by MrHarris– Will^you^please take out the one addressed to you, and drop the others in your Post-office,
               unless you see the men to hand them to in person, in which case please do that–

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed the letter. He also authored the address on the back
                  page, which was folded to create an envelope.
2The enclosed letters included Lincoln’sletterto John Bennett of the previous day.

               unless you see the men to hand them to in person, in which case please do that–
